newsitem.title: HONG KONG: PRESS DIGEST - HK Newspaper Headlines - Jan 24.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - HK Newspaper Headlines - Jan 24.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Hong Kong press on Friday. Reuter has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- MING PAO -- Chief Executive-designate Tung Chee-hwa backed the proposal of the Preparatory Committee's legal panel to appeal or amend 25 Hong Kong laws.
-- From this year, dog owners in Guangzhou had to apply for ID cards for their pets for 10,000 yuan each.
-- EXPRESS NEWS -- Facing tough market competition, the territory's biggest telecommunications company Hutchison Telecom planned to lay off 2,000 staff before Chinese New Year.

-- APPLE DAILY - Former director of the New China News Agency in Hong Kong, Xu Jiatun, who had gone to the U.S. after the Beijing massacre in 1989, has made known to the Communist Party he wants to return to live in his native Jiangsu province. Beijing has not responded.
-- WEN WEI PO -- Director of the New China News Agency branch in Hong Kong, Zhou Nan, said Shenzhen had made considerable contributions to the Hong Kong handover.
-- SOUTH CHINA MORNING POST -- The HOng Kong stock exchange is proposing to introduce a pre-opening session to help boost volume and stabilise prices.
-- China might close down some illegal Sino-foreign retail joint ventures as it opened the sector in more cities this year.
-- HONGKONG STANDARD -- Standard Chartered Bank and three other foreign banks have received approval from China's central bank to conduct yuan business in Shanghai.
-- The Hong Kong Futures Exchange plans to relaunch interest rate futures in the first half of this year.
